newsArray.title: Nobody else will be stupid enough to play Tests at 40 but I won‚Äôt quit playing for England, says James Anderson
creator: John Etheridge
newsArray.content: JAMES ANDERSON is convinced he will be the last 40-year-old to play Test cricket for England. Swing-king Anderson fears the lure of easy money in Twenty20 events could shorten the careers of players in the five-day format. PAJames Anderson is not just the oldest swinger in town but also around the globe as he targets Test wickets for England aged 40[/caption] James Anderson fears Test cricket will never see the likes of him and fellow England quickie Stuart Broad againGetty Anderson is poised to become the first specialist quick bowler in 61 years to take an England Test wicket over the age of 40. He has no plans to hang up his bowling boots but believes others are likely to follow the lead of Kiwi star Trent Boult, who last week announced at 33 he plans to play fewer internationals and focus on lucrative franchise events. Asked if there will be another 40-year-old playing for England, Anderson said: ‚ÄúMaybe Broady but definitely not after that because no one will be stupid enough. ‚ÄúWith franchise cricket, The Hundred, short forms, I can‚Äôt see anyone wanting to play Test cricket this long. I see more and more doing what Trent Boult has done. READ MORE IN SPORT HARRY UP Ronaldo and Maguire ‚Äòamong five stars demanding transfers in crisis meeting‚Äô LIVERPOOL 1 PALACE 1 Diaz stunner rescues winless Reds after Nunez sent off for HEADBUTT FREE BETS AND SIGN UP DEALS ‚Äì BEST NEW CUSTOMER OFFERS ‚ÄúIt makes me sad because Test cricket will probably bear the brunt. The easiest thing for bowlers is to bowl four overs or 20 balls. That takes nothing out of you. ‚ÄúAnd if you‚Äôre getting paid just as well as you would in Test cricket, it probably makes sense. It will tempt more people.‚Äù Back in 1961, Derbyshire bowler Les Jackson played the second of his two Tests (the first was in 1949) and his four wickets were the last by a specialist England seamer aged 40. In 1994, Graham Gooch was the most recent 40-plus (he was actually 41) to take a wicket for England but he was mainly a batsman, of course. Most read in Sport RED DEVILS LATEST Aubemeyang lined up, Ronaldo 'eating ALONE', De Jong boost MENDY‚ÄôS ‚ÄòLAIR‚Äô Inside Benjamin Mendy‚Äôs mansion where he ‚Äòraped victims in panic rooms‚Äô RIP LEGEND Burnley and Swansea hero Lenny Johnrose, 52, dies five years after MND diagnosis 'RAPE HOUSE' ‚ÄòPredator‚Äô Mendy 'told victim "don't move" as he pinned arms back & raped her' WANDA BRA Wanda cheekily edits boob pic to avoid ban as Icardi 'closes on Utd move' RON STROP Cristiano Ronaldo 'granted permission to LEAVE Man Utd in stunning transfer exit' So Anderson is poised to achieve something very rare as the First Test against South Africa starts at Lord‚Äôs tomorrow. He did some TV punditry on England‚Äôs white-ball matches in July and during The Hundred. But Anderson could not wait to get back to bowling. He said: ‚ÄúEveryone gets better with experience in whatever walk of life. ‚ÄúI keep working on stuff, playing around with seam positions and different balls, trying to disguise things more so people can‚Äôt see the swing. ‚ÄúForty is just a number. It‚Äôs not how I feel ‚Äî I don‚Äôt feel like I‚Äôm slowing down. ‚ÄúThe last few weeks, I‚Äôve been training hard. In the last¬† couple of days‚Äô practice here at Lord‚Äôs, I feel in great rhythm so hopefully I can show that on the field. ‚ÄúI definitely feel proud of where I‚Äôve got to.¬† And very fortunate I still have the love for the game and the desire to get better. My passion is still there. My body is functioning properly, allowing me to do the job I love. James Anderson ‚ÄúWith a lot of people, that‚Äôs the first thing that goes and that‚Äôs when you start winding down. ‚ÄúBut my passion is still there. My body is functioning properly, allowing me to do the job I love.‚Äù England have so far won all four Test matches under captain Ben Stokes and coach Brendon ‚ÄúBaz‚Äù McCullum with four epic run chases. The Proteas reckon ‚ÄúBazball‚Äù is a myth that will come unstuck. But Anderson added: ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been itching to get back. Those four Tests were incredible. ‚ÄúWhat we did on the field was great but the energy in the dressing room was brilliant. I felt as happy as I have in an England dressing room for¬† years. ‚ÄúEveryone feels the same ‚Äî really excited to get going. ‚ÄúBen and Brendon know how they want us to play. We‚Äôre buying into that and absolutely loving it.‚Äù Lord‚Äôs will again turn ‚ÄúRed for Ruth‚Äù in honour of ex-England captain Andrew Strauss‚Äô late wife and the foundation he set up in her name to help families facing the death of a parent.

newsArray.title: ‚ÄúA bit like an AB de Villiers‚Äù: Ricky Ponting rates Suryakumar Yadav at par with de Villiers; considers him a must in India‚Äôs T20 World Cup squad
creator: Gurpreet Singh
newsArray.description: Ricky Ponting rates Suryakumar Yadav alongside the legendary AB de Villiers considering his wide range of shots all across the the ground. Ever since making his T20I debut for India during the home series against England last year in Ahmedabad, where he ramped the English pacer Jofra Archer for a Six on the very first‚Ä¶ The post ‚ÄúA bit like an AB de Villiers‚Äù: Ricky Ponting rates Suryakumar Yadav at par with de Villiers; considers him a must in India‚Äôs T20 World Cup squad appeared first on The SportsRush.
newsArray.content: Ricky Ponting rates Suryakumar Yadav alongside the legendary AB de Villiers considering his wide range of shots all across the the ground. Ever since making his T20I debut for India during the home series against England last year in Ahmedabad, where he ramped the English pacer Jofra Archer for a Six on the very first ball of his innings, there has been no looking back for the right-hander. Post the recently concluded tour of England, where he scored his maiden T20I ton at Nottingham, which was also arguably one of the finest T20 knock by an Indian off-late, Yadav again found his mention in the words of praises of fans and experts of the game. Post the limited Overs series against West Indies, the 31-year-old even went on to reach the second spot in the ICC Men‚Äôs T20I rankings for batters, just behind the Pakistan skipper Babar Azam. Ricky Ponting rates Suryakumar Yadav at par with de Villiers With the ICC T20 World Cup in Australia just a couple of months away from its commencement, legendary Australian skipper, during an interaction with the ICC, compared Suryakumar Yadav with the legendary Proteas batter AB de Villiers, considering his wide range of shots in all parts of the cricket field. ‚ÄúSurya (Yadav) scores 360 degrees around the ground, a bit like an AB de Villiers did when he was in his actual prime. The lap shots, the late cuts, you know, the ramps over the keeper‚Äôs head. He can hit down the ground,‚Äù Ponting said. ‚ÄúHe hits really well over the leg side, flicks to deep backward square particularly well, and he‚Äôs a good player of fast bowling and is a good player of spin bowling,‚Äù he further added. The museum of Suryakumar Yadav‚Äôs strokeplay. pic.twitter.com/CTM8v1m1cK ‚Äî CricBlog (@cric_blog) August 4, 2022 ALSO READ: ‚ÄúI will be fearing playing an Indian team that has Virat Kohli in it‚Äù, reckons Ponting ‚ÄúFor Surya, it‚Äôs one, two or four‚Äù: Ricky Ponting A huge part of Yadav‚Äôs reputation is mostly due to his performances in the IPL, particularly for his present franchise Mumbai Indians in the previous few seasons. Ponting, as MI coach has seen Yadav enough during his initial years with the franchise. The former Aussie skipper, while stating Yadav as an automatic pick in the Indian squad for the imminent T20 World Cup, also picked batting positions 1,2 or 4 as ideal for him in the team, with Virat Kohli at his traditional no.3 spot. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs got to be in the top four, I think. I said stick with him (Virat) in his traditional spot, which has been number three. For Surya, it‚Äôs one, two or four. I think he can open, but I think he‚Äôs probably, you know, if you could probably just keep him away from the new ball, let him control the middle part of the game outside the Powerplay, through in the middle, and if he‚Äôs in at the end, you know what can happens,‚Äù remarked Ponting. The post ‚ÄúA bit like an AB de Villiers‚Äù: Ricky Ponting rates Suryakumar Yadav at par with de Villiers; considers him a must in India‚Äôs T20 World Cup squad appeared first on The SportsRush.

newsArray.title: Highlights, Ireland vs Afghanistan, 4th T20I: AFG win by 27 runs
creator: FirstCricket Staff
newsArray.description: Highlights, Ireland vs Afghanistan, 4th T20I: AFG win by 27 runs
newsArray.content: Preview: Afghanistan would look to script a comeback of sorts when they face Ireland in the fourth T20I of the five-match series in Belfast on Monday.Ireland currently lead the series 2-1, having clinched the first two games, but Naveen-ul-haq and Rahmanullah Gurbaz helped the Afghans stay alive in the series with a 22-run win in the third T20I.Ireland, meanwhile, can wrap up the series with a game to spare, should they win the fourth T20I on Monday.This series is crucial for both the teams, with the T20 World Cup in Australia slated for later this year.Read all the Latest News, Trending News, Cricket News, Bollywood News, India News and Entertainment News here. Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

newsArray.title: Cricket: Nigeria ready to host ICC U-19 World Cup Qualifiers
creator: Agency Report
newsArray.description: Ehizoje says Nigeria is very ready to host the tournament as there are good grounds available The post Cricket: Nigeria ready to host ICC U-19 World Cup Qualifiers appeared first on Premium Times Nigeria.
newsArray.content: The Nigeria Cricket Federation (NCF) says it is ready to host the International Cricket Council (ICC) U-19 Africa Division 2 World Cup qualifiers in September. Musa Ehizoje, the NCF‚Äôs public relations officer, told the News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) in Abuja on Monday,l that preparations are in place to host the eight-nation tournament in Abuja. ‚ÄúNigeria is very ready to host the tournament. The most important aspect of hosting a tournament is already in place, which is the grounds. ‚ÄúWe have twin pitches at the Moshood Abiola National Stadium, Abuja and they are ready,‚Äù Mr Ehizoje said. Considering the prevalent security challenges in the country, the NCF official said the ICC was satisfied with the country‚Äôs security details. ‚ÄúThere are no challenges with regards to security. ‚ÄúBefore any country will be given the right to host any tournament, ICC must be comfortable with your security plan and they are comfortable with our security details. ‚ÄúNigeria can boast of the best security architecture in hosting tournaments as there has never been a case where there are security threats in our competitions both local and international,‚Äù he said. Mr Ehizoje said the decision to grant Nigeria the hosting rights was due to her grassroots development efforts in promoting the game. ‚ÄúThis is not the first time Nigeria is hosting an ICC qualifier. We hosted the T20 Qualifier A in 2018 in Lagos. ‚ÄúThis will be the second time and it is because the world cricket governing body has seen what Nigeria is doing with regards to grassroots cricket development. ‚ÄúAbuja also provides a natural solution to host the competition because of the twin pitches at the stadium and both are turf wickets. ‚ÄúThis is a 50 overs competition and you will require a minimum of two pitches at close proximity and that‚Äôs why Abuja has been chosen,‚Äù Mr Ehizoje added. The tournament is scheduled for 28 September to 9 October. NAN Donate TEXT AD: Call Willie - +2348098788999

newsArray.title: Will MS Dhoni play in CSA T20 league: Will Dhoni play for Johannesburg Super Kings in South African T20 league?
creator: Gurpreet Singh
newsArray.description: Will MS Dhoni play in CSA T20 league: The Chennai Super Kings Sports Limited has acquired the Johannesburg franchise in the league. Six owners of the Indian Premier League (IPL) teams ‚Äì Mumbai Indians, Chennai Super Kings, Lucknow Super Giants, Sunrisers Hyderabad, Rajasthan Royals, and one of the owners of Delhi Capitals have successfully managed‚Ä¶ The post Will MS Dhoni play in CSA T20 league: Will Dhoni play for Johannesburg Super Kings in South African T20 league? appeared first on The SportsRush.
newsArray.content: Will MS Dhoni play in CSA T20 league: The Chennai Super Kings Sports Limited has acquired the Johannesburg franchise in the league. Six owners of the Indian Premier League (IPL) teams ‚Äì Mumbai Indians, Chennai Super Kings, Lucknow Super Giants, Sunrisers Hyderabad, Rajasthan Royals, and one of the owners of Delhi Capitals have successfully managed to buy one each of the six teams set to partake in Cricket South Africa‚Äôs upcoming T20 league in January 2023. The development has set the social media abuzz, with fans eager to have each and every information possible on the details of this franchise league, which has managed to garner the attention of the IPL team owners. FALY OF TEAMS! @mipaltan Read more ‚Äì https://t.co/GfKn0ZhoDj #OneFamily #MIcapetown @OfficialCSA pic.twitter.com/pGxPwqWJvq ‚Äî MI Cape Town (@MICapeTown) August 10, 2022 CSA has even decided to put their national team‚Äôs chances of qualification for the 2023 ODI World Cup under threat, to ensure their new venture‚Äôs sustained success. With the involvement of the Indian owners, fans have been eager to know whether or not the BCCI would tweak their rules to allow Indian players to participate in the South African league. Will MS Dhoni play in CSA T20 league During an interaction with the Indian Express, one of the BCCI officials reiterated the board‚Äôs previous stand of not allowing the Indian players ‚Äì active or retired, to partake in any of the overseas T20 leagues in any capacity, unless they have cut their ties with the BCCI. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs clear, no Indian player including domestic players can take part in any other league until he is retired from all forms of the game. If any player wants to take part in these upcoming leagues he can only do so when he cuts off all ties with the BCCI,‚Äù a BCCI official told The Indian Express. Discussions were rife on whether the current Chennai Super Kings skipper MS Dhoni can join the Johannesburg Super Kings (owned by the Chennai Super Kings Sports Limited) at least in the capacity of a mentor, if not a player. Responding to the same, the BCCI official remarked, ‚ÄúThen he can‚Äôt play IPL for CSK. He has to retire here first.‚Äù Thus, for Dhoni, or any other retired Indian player to participate in the CSA T20 league, or any other overseas league, he would have to retire from the IPL first. The post Will MS Dhoni play in CSA T20 league: Will Dhoni play for Johannesburg Super Kings in South African T20 league? appeared first on The SportsRush.

newsArray.title: Chucking meaning in Cricket: What is chucking in cricket? Is Mohammad Hasnain bowling action objectionable?
creator: Gurpreet Singh
newsArray.description: Chucking meaning in Cricket: Pakistan pacer Mohammad Hasnain‚Äôs action dominated headlines yet again during The Hundred 2022 match on Sunday. During the 14th match of the ongoing The Hundred Men‚Äôs competition between the Oval Invincibles and Southern Brave, at the Kennington Oval in London, Brave‚Äôs all-rounder Marcus Stoinis seemed to be questioning the legality of‚Ä¶ The post Chucking meaning in Cricket: What is chucking in cricket? Is Mohammad Hasnain bowling action objectionable? appeared first on The SportsRush.
newsArray.content: Chucking meaning in Cricket: Pakistan pacer Mohammad Hasnain‚Äôs action dominated headlines yet again during The Hundred 2022 match on Sunday. During the 14th match of the ongoing The Hundred Men‚Äôs competition between the Oval Invincibles and Southern Brave, at the Kennington Oval in London, Brave‚Äôs all-rounder Marcus Stoinis seemed to be questioning the legality of Pakistan and Invincibles‚Äô pacer Mohammad Hasnain‚Äôs delivery after getting dismissed. During the 61st delivery of the innings, Stoinis (37 off 27) got dismissed off a short delivery bowled by Hasnain, which perhaps got big on him, to ultimately flat-bat it high in the air and caught by the fielder at mid-off. Post the dismissal, Stoinis explicitly seemed to suggest that the Pakistani pacer‚Äôs action during his dismissal delivery was a chucking one, for which the latter has been accused of earlier as well and was resultantly also suspended from bowling for a brief period earlier this year. ‚ÄòChucking‚Äô refers to an illegal bowling action which occurs when a bowler throws the ball instead of bowling. As per the ICC rules and regulations regarding illegal bowling actions, a bowler‚Äôs action is illegal if his/her elbow extends by an amount of more than 15 degrees between their arm reaching the horizontal and the ball being released. ICC tests the players‚Äô action using high-tech biomechanics and experts to determine the legality. If a bowler is found to be chucking, he/she needs to get their action rectified before they are allowed to take the field once again in international cricket. Chucking in cricket is illegal as it gives an added advantage to the bowlers in the game. If a bowler flexes his/her arm over 15 degrees, he/she gets to generate more pace and thus make it unfairly difficult for the batters to play. Hasnain‚Äôs bowling action was reported by umpire Gerard Abood during the Big Bash League (BBL) match between Sydney Thunder and Adelaide Strikers in January this year. After undergoing the Biomechanics tests, it was confirmed by the findings of the Lahore University of Management Sciences, that the pacer was indeed bending his elbow more than the permissible 15 degrees limit by the ICC. After facing suspension from bowling for a brief period, the 22-year-old was declared fit to bowl again following a tweak in his action which met the ICC‚Äôs set limit. This is the video of Mohammmad Husnain bowling to Marcus Stoinis and Stoinis signalling that Husnain is chucking. This is disrespectful from him #Stoinis #Husnain #hundred pic.twitter.com/YXmxzF9tj8 ‚Äî Homunculus (@MrStrangedoc) August 15, 2022 Really bad of @MStoinis to imply that Hasnain is chucking the ball. pic.twitter.com/GdX3wyN9fl ‚Äî Haroon (@hazharoon) August 14, 2022 This is shocking !!! Hasnain has been cleared & it has nothing to do with Stoinis @thehundred #TheHundred https://t.co/vMTw0KC9MG ‚Äî Azeem Rafiq (@AzeemRafiq30) August 14, 2022 Disappointing reaction from Marcus Stoinis after he was dismissed by Mohammad Hasnain. How about sticking to playing cricket and letting the officials do their job #TheHundred #Cricket pic.twitter.com/oYOSb12GTr ‚Äî Saj Sadiq (@SajSadiqCricket) August 14, 2022 For more Cricket-related news, click here .

newsArray.title: Siddhesh Lad, the ‚Äòcrisis man‚Äô of Mumbai cricket, likely to join Arjun Tendulkar and play for Goa
creator: Devendra Pandey
newsArray.content: Mumbai middle-order batsman Siddhesh Lad, 30, has sought a No Objection Certificate (NOC) from Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA) to allow him to play for a new state in the upcoming domestic season. If everything goes right, Lad says he will represent neighbouring state Goa . Lad will be the second player after Indian icon son Sachin, Arjun Tendulkar, to play for Goa. Few days ago, Tendulkar Jr too had decided to move to Goa to get more opportunities. ‚ÄúIt was an honour to represent Mumbai for almost a decade . I feel it‚Äôs time for me to explore more opportunities coming my way. I would also like to thank MCA , all the support staff and players who have been a part of my journey with MCA,‚Äù Lad told The Indian Express . ‚ÄúA few teams have [shown interest] but I am in talks with Goa at the moment.‚Äù Lad played 61 first-class games, scoring 4058 runs at an average of 40. He slammed 1140 runs in 39 List A games, scoring 842 runs at 24. He was also part of Mumbai Indians and Kolkata Knight Riders team. Subscriber Only Stories View All Premium UPSC Key-August 15, 2022: Why you should read ‚ÄòKhongjom war‚Äô or ‚ÄòVision I... Premium C Raja Mohan writes: Diplomacy for Viksit Bharat Premium UPSC Essentials: Key terms of the past week with MCQs Premium ExplainSpeaking | India at 75: 11 charts to understand how far India has ... Subscribe Now to get 62% OFF Lad has been part of one Ranji Trophy and two Vijay Hazare Trophy winning squads for Mumbai. His place looked under doubt after the selectors decided to give chances to more youngsters waiting in the wings. He didn‚Äôt find a place in the red-ball Mumbai squad post the pandemic. He was part of Mumbai team in Vijay Hazare Trophy and Syed Mushtaq Ali in 2021 but couldn‚Äôt convert his starts into big scores. Lad explained it was a difficult decision to leave a state where he has played all his cricket. He is the son of Dinesh Lad, who has coached India players like Rohit Sharma and Shardul Thakur. Advertisement ‚ÄúMemories are endless but lifting the Ranji Trophy surely is the best memory. Yes, it will be difficult (to play for some other state) but I am ready to accept the challenge,‚Äù Lad says. Explained by The Indian Express Do not just read the news. Understand it. newsArray.title: James Anderson: There are unlikely to be many more Test players in their forties
newsArray.description: England seamer James Anderson admits he is fortunate to still have the passion for Test cricket but feels it is unlikely there will be many more playing beyond their 40th birthday.

newsArray.title: English cricket needs to react as world game continues to shift ‚Äì Andrew Strauss
Test and T20 cricket can sit together, feels Strauss
newsArray.content: Test cricket and T20 can comfortably co-exist despite the mushrooming of franchise-based leagues, feels former England captain Andrew Strauss. Strauss, who is currently the chairman of the England and Wales Cricket Board‚Äôs (ECB)cricket committee, took into consideration the expanded two and half months window for the IPL while making the assessment.‚ÄùOne thing we know in other countries, Test cricket doesn‚Äôt pay the bills, like it does here,‚Äù Strauss told the Daily Telegraph. ‚ÄúThe T20 format is the way that a lot of people get introduced to the game in the first place. I still maintain that they can sit together comfortably, Test and T20 cricket. ‚ÄúBut the challenge we have is (to provide a) manageable schedule that allows players to do both. That is really complicated. It‚Äôs multi-dimensional,‚Äù Strauss added. Recently star New Zealand left-arm pacer Trent Boult pulled out of the central contract so that he has more time to play franchise cricket.‚ÄùIt definitely feels like right at the moment, the rate of change is increasing.‚ÄùAnd the truth is, none of us know what‚Äôs around the corner so you can all look into the future and go, ‚ÄòYeah, we‚Äôre going to have this situation where players are signed up to franchises for 12 months of the year and there‚Äôs less international cricket. We don‚Äôt know any of that at this point,‚Äù he said. Subscriber Only Stories View All Premium UPSC Key-August 15, 2022: Why you should read ‚ÄòKhongjom war‚Äô or ‚ÄòVision I... Premium C Raja Mohan writes: Diplomacy for Viksit Bharat Premium UPSC Essentials: Key terms of the past week with MCQs Premium ExplainSpeaking | India at 75: 11 charts to understand how far India has ... Subscribe Now to get 62% OFF ‚ÄúThey (the players) will always look at those opportunities side by side and decide what‚Äôs best for them and you don‚Äôt hold that against them,‚Äù Strauss said. ‚ÄúAnd so we need to continue promoting all the brilliant things that cricket in this country offers players. we want to have a strong vibrant domestic game and we want to make sure the players are playing the right balance of formats as well so that it‚Äôs not all drifting down that white-ball short-form route. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs still plenty of players that want to commit and challenge themselves to be the best Test cricketers they can be,‚Äù Strauss, who is leading the high-performance review into the future of the English game, said. Urging the English cricketers to be nimble and ‚Äúadaptable to changes‚Äù, Strauss said: ‚ÄúWe can‚Äôt afford to be slow moving and have our heads in the sand. Click here for more ‚ÄúI think that‚Äôs really important that we set ourselves up in this country, we set the game up in a way that allows us to be flexible and adaptable.‚Äù Explained by The Indian Express Do not just read the news. Understand it. Read our daily explainers Read now

newsArray.title: NED vs PAK ODI record head to head: Netherlands vs Pakistan head to head records in ODI history
creator: Dixit Bhargav
newsArray.description: NED vs PAK ODI record head to head: The SportsRush presents for you the Head to Head statistics for the first NED vs PAK ODI. The first ODI of Pakistan‚Äôs tour of Netherlands 2022 will be played in Rotterdam tomorrow. A three-match ODI series will be part of the ongoing ICC Men‚Äôs World Cup Super‚Ä¶ The post NED vs PAK ODI record head to head: Netherlands vs Pakistan head to head records in ODI history appeared first on The SportsRush.
newsArray.content: NED vs PAK ODI record head to head: The SportsRush presents for you the Head to Head statistics for the first NED vs PAK ODI. The first ODI of Pakistan‚Äôs tour of Netherlands 2022 will be played in Rotterdam tomorrow. A three-match ODI series will be part of the ongoing ICC Men‚Äôs World Cup Super League. Readers must note that both the teams‚Äô last ODI assignments were also a three-match series. While Netherlands had last hosted England in June, Pakistan‚Äôs last ODI series was against West Indies at home in the same month. Currently at the fifth position on the points table of the Super League, Pakistan have won nine and lost six out of their 15 ODIs in this period. Netherlands, on the other hand, are reeling at the bottom of the points table due to just two wins and as many as 13 losses out of their 16 matches. Set to resume their ODI rivalry after a mammoth 19 years, the last Netherlands vs Pakistan ODI was played during the ICC Cricket World Cup 2003. Individual three-wicket hauls by the then Pakistan new-ball bowlers Wasim Akram and Shoaib Akhtar had played titular roles in bundling out Netherlands for 156 in a 254-run chase. Considering the number of ODIs played between these two teams, there‚Äôs not much to be mentioned in the head-to-head segment for this match. A vast gap since their last match also makes mentioning numbers (both for teams and individual players) slightly irrelevant. That being said, it is noteworthy that Netherlands and Pakistan had played an ODI each during the ICC Cricket World Cup 1996 (Lahore), ICC Champions Trophy 2002 (Colombo) and 2003 World Cup (Paarl). üíØ% effort in the field to stay on üîù #NEDvPAK | #BackTheBoysInGreen pic.twitter.com/mYFNhwJvEz ‚Äî Pakistan Cricket (@TheRealPCB) August 15, 2022 Barring their first-ever ODI, the remaining two matches were played at neutral venues. Pakistan, who will be playing their first-ever bilateral ODI in Netherlands on Tuesday, have won all their ODIs against this opposition till date.

newsArray.title: Flamborough CC seal promotion despite loss to Ravenscar
creator: Andy Bloomfield
newsArray.description: Flamborough secured promotion to CPH Scarborough Beckett Cricket League Division Two despite losing out by eight wickets at title rivals Ravenscar.

newsArray.title: Harbhajan Singh reveals how MS Dhoni helped him turn around the match against Pakistan during 2011 World Cup
creator: FirstCricket Staff
newsArray.description: Harbhajan Singh reveals how MS Dhoni helped him turn around the match against Pakistan during 2011 World Cup
newsArray.content: Team India's 2011 World Cup win remains etched in the memory of every cricket fan. It was the Men in Blue‚Äôs second ODI World Cup win after 28 years and it came under the captaincy of MS Dhoni. India defeated Sri Lanka by six wickets in the summit clash, which was played at the iconic Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai.Notably, to make it to the final, India had got the better of arch-rivals Pakistan in the semi-final match in Mohali. Talking about the high-octane clash, former India spinner Harbhajan Singh revealed how Dhoni‚Äôs advice helped him get a crucial breakthrough, which was also his first wicket of the match.After opting to bat first against Pakistan in the semis, India rode on Sachin Tendulkar‚Äôs 115-ball 85 to set a challenging 261-run target for the arch-nemesis.During the run-chase, Pakistan lost the plot after a brisk start and were reeling at 106/4. However, their then skipper Misbah-ul-Haq helped the Men in Green to bounce back in the match as he started to build a dangerous-looking partnership with Umar Akmal, who was quick in scoring runs and even smashed a four and two sixes during his stay at the crease.However, Dhoni came up with a master plan that helped Harbhajan to break the partnership between Misbah and Akmal.Some #GreatestRivalry stories are best narrated "dil se" by our legends themselves!Relive the banter with @harbhajan_singh, @ImZaheer & @jatinsapru & gear up to #BelieveInBlue for #INDvPAK! #AsiaCup2022 | Aug 28, 6 PM | Star Sports & Disney+Hotstar pic.twitter.com/KPGsicJDoW‚Äî Star Sports (@StarSportsIndia) August 14, 2022"It was one of those games where I felt I was getting a bit numb. I had bowled five overs and conceded around 26-27 runs. It was a water break, and Dhoni told me, 'Bhajju pa, aap vahan se daaloge' (around the wicket). Kamran (Umar) was playing good, so was Misbah. And they were scoring runs and the partnership was getting dangerous," Harbhajan said as he recalled the moment on Star Sports' Dil Se India."So I came to bowl. I remembered God. I just prayed for a win. And God did listen to me. On the very first ball, I got the wicket of Kamran (Umar) Akmal as I bowled around the wicket. He completely missed the ball."Interestingly, Akmal‚Äôs wicket proved to be the turning point of the match as, after his dismissal, Pakistan‚Äôs batting order collapsed as they lost their star all-rounder duo of Abdul Razzaq (3) and Shahid Afridi (19) cheaply, while Misbah (56) tried to hold the fort from the other end. But, it was not enough for the Men in Green as they were bowled out for 231, thus losing the match by 29 runs.Read all the Latest News, Trending News, Cricket News, Bollywood News, India News and Entertainment News here. Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

newsArray.title: Cricket - South Africa not sure how to deal with ‚ÄòBazball‚Äô
newsArray.description: LONDON (Reuters) - South Africa are not sure how they are going to deal with England‚Äôs new aggressive approach to playing test cricket with coach Mark Boucher saying on Monday they will adopt a wait-and-see attitude when the first test starts at Lord‚Äôs on Wednesday. Read full story

newsArray.title: ‚ÄòA big Rubik‚Äôs Cube‚Äô: Strauss believes Test and T20 cricket can sit together
creator: Simon Burnton
newsArray.description: ‚ÄòThe cricket world is changing unbelievably quickly‚ÄôGlobal franchise leagues giving players more optionsAndrew Strauss has warned those leading cricket in England and Wales they ‚Äúcan‚Äôt afford to be slow-moving and have our heads in the sand‚Äù during a time of unprecedented flux in the sport.With the proliferation of global franchise leagues accelerating, T20s offer players and television networks an alternative focus to the longer-format internationals that have traditionally sat at the pinnacle of the game. ‚ÄúThe cricket world around us is changing unbelievably quickly. Every day, every week, every month, we‚Äôre seeing a new example of how that world is changing,‚Äù Strauss said, as the high-performance review he is leading for the ECB prepares to report on the future of the game at elite level. Continue reading...
newsArray.content: Andrew Strauss has warned those leading cricket in England and Wales they ‚Äúcan‚Äôt afford to be slow-moving and have our heads in the sand‚Äù during a time of unprecedented flux in the sport. With the proliferation of global franchise leagues accelerating, T20s offer players and television networks an alternative focus to the longer-format internationals that have traditionally sat at the pinnacle of the game. ‚ÄúThe cricket world around us is changing unbelievably quickly. Every day, every week, every month, we‚Äôre seeing a new example of how that world is changing,‚Äù Strauss said, as the high-performance review he is leading for the ECB prepares to report on the future of the game at elite level. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre having to ask ourselves in this country, where does our game fit into that? We [need to] make sure that we have incentives there for our players to play both red- and white-ball cricket. Of course, the ECB have put a lot of time and attention and effort into [giving] the Hundred the potential to be a global short-form event that matches any of these other leagues. ‚ÄúOne of the things that we need to be conscious of in the game in this country is we have to be nimble and adaptable. And we can‚Äôt afford to be slow moving and have our heads in the sand. That‚Äôs really important ‚Äì that we set the game up in a way that allows us to be flexible because ultimately players, if they‚Äôve got many opportunities, will always look at those opportunities side by side and decide what‚Äôs best for them. ‚ÄúWe need to continue promoting all the brilliant things cricket in this country offers players ‚Äì we want to have a strong domestic game and we want to make sure the players are playing the right balance of formats so that it‚Äôs not all drifting down that white-ball, short-form route.‚Äù Sign up to The Spin Free weekly newsletter Subscribe to our cricket newsletter for our writers' thoughts on the biggest stories and a review of the week‚Äôs action Privacy Notice: Newsletters may contain info about charities, online ads, and content funded by outside parties. For more information see our Privacy Policy . We use Google reCaptcha to protect our website and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply. Though some think it will prove impossible for Test and ODI cricket to continue in their current forms given the amount of T20 matches being scheduled ‚Äì the former India coach Ravi Shastri, for example, suggested last month that the number of Test-playing nations should be halved from its current 12 ‚Äì Strauss said he feels more optimistic. ‚ÄúI still maintain they can sit together comfortably, Test cricket and T20 cricket. But the challenge we have is, can we produce a manageable schedule that allows players to do both? That is really complicated. It‚Äôs multi-dimensional. It‚Äôs like a big Rubik‚Äôs Cube.‚Äù Richard Thompson‚Äôs in-tray: key tasks for ECB chair with cricket in turmoil Read more After winning their first four Tests of the summer against New Zealand and India, England‚Äôs Test side will get another opportunity to demonstrate their recent improvement when the three-Test series against South Africa starts at Lord‚Äôs on Wednesday. Spectators at the second day will be invited to wear red in support of the Ruth Strauss Foundation , set up by the former England captain after the death of his wife, Ruth. The foundation aims to assist families facing the death of a parent and to encourage research into non-smoking lung cancers. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs early days and there are still a lot of areas of improvement,‚Äù Strauss, who was England‚Äôs director of cricket for three years, said of the Test team‚Äôs upturned fortunes under the captaincy of Ben Stokes and with Brendon McCullum as coach. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just brilliant to see players playing with a smile on their face, enjoying the challenge, not worried so much about what might go wrong. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre more excited about doing things that haven‚Äôt been done before ‚Äì pioneering, changing the face of the game or however you want to describe it. The more you have that mindset in the dressing room the more confidence builds, the more you are able to do extraordinary things. We saw it with the white-ball team post-2015 and we‚Äôre going to see it again with this Test team.‚Äù

newsArray.title: Cricket Australia unveils 5-year strategic plan; know details
newsArray.description: In a welcome move, Cricket Australia launched a five-year strategic plan to increase the numbers of players in the age group of 5 to 12 while also prioritising the need to get fans back to watch the game live.
